summary:
PERSONAL STATEMENT
•A Postdoc in the Institute of Biology of Leiden University, the Netherlands.
•Skills and knowledge for analytical biochemistry, pharmaceutical analysis and statistics. Experiences in biochemical research and metabolomics research with operation of Mass Spectrometry and HPLC instruments. Studies mainly on metabolic biomarker selections and their potential biological interpretations on urine/plasma samples from human/animal disease model (Rheumatoid arthritis & Diabetes type 2).
•Also experienced research in: a) extraction, purification , quantification, and active functional studies of Chinese herbal products; b) Potential drug candidate(s) selections, their potential synergistic effect and mechanism on immunomodulation in animal (zebrafish) model system.

EDUCATION BACKGROUND
•2012-2016 Leiden University (the Netherlands), PhD, major in analytical biosciences. 
Projects: Studies on potential metabolic biomarkers for diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis and their potential pathologies for the RA mechanism; Combinations of different techniques (metabolites vs. ultra-weak photon emission guided by Chinese medicine) for developing effective diagnostic tools for personalized medicine.
•2008-2011 Changchun University of Traditional Chinese Medicine (China), Master degree candidate, major in Pharmaceutical chemistry. 
Projects in M.Sc.: Studies on methodologies of extraction, isolation and structural identifications of biological active natural products from Chinese herbal material ; Some natural products extracted from Lonicera japonica Thunb. were found to inhibit bacterial biofilms. 
•2003-2007 Jiamusi University (China), Bachelor student, major in Pharmacy. 
Basic course study including both Western and Chinese herbal medicine, as well as experimental anatomy (including animal anatomy) and physiology (including animal physiology), etc.. 

OTHER SKILLS:
•Statistical software: SPSS, Cytoscape, R studio (basic), graph pad, Fiji, photoshop, etc,.
